aa.definition: a volcanic rock consisting of angular blocks of lava with a very rough surface.
aa.example: The hiker collected samples of aa from the volcanic crater.

ab.example: She strained her ab muscles during her workout.

ad.example: He placed an ad in the newspaper to sell his car.

ag.example: The chemical symbol Ag represents silver in the periodic table.

ah.definition: an exclamation expressing relief, satisfaction, or admiration.
ah.example: Ah, that's much better! exclaimed the relieved student.

al.example: Aluminum (Al) is a lightweight metal used in various applications.

am.example: The train to the city leaves at 9 am.

an.definition: used with units of measurement to mean one.
an.example: Could you pass me an apple, please?

ar.example: Argon (Ar) is a noble gas commonly used in light bulbs.

as.definition: used in comparisons to refer to the extent or degree of something.
as.example: please go as fast as you can

at.definition: expressing location or arrival in a particular place or position.

aw.definition: an exclamation expressing mild protest, entreaty, or sympathy
aw.example: 'Aw, that's disgusting!' cried the child, seeing the mess.

ax.definition: a tool typically used for chopping or splitting wood.
ax.example: He used an ax to chop firewood for the winter.

ay.definition: an exclamation expressing sorrow or surprise.
ay.example: Ay, caramba! exclaimed Miguel in surprise.

ba.definition: a first university degree in a subject such as history, languages, or English literature
ba.example: He has a BA in French.

be.example: To be or not to be, that is the question.

bi.example: She is bi, so she is attracted to both men and women.

bo.example: He needs to address his B.O. issue.

by.example: The park is located by the river.

da.definition: an official prosecutor for a judicial district.
da.example: He was also certain the judge and the DA (district attorney) had already conspired.

de.definition: either of the two defensive players positioned at the end of the players who are linemen.
de.example: What is a Defensive End in American Football? (DE Position Guide).

do.example: What do you want to do tonight?

ed.example: Teacher Don taught phys ed at a junior high school.

ef.example: Ef is the 6th letter of the alphabet.

eh.definition: used to ask for confirmation or repetition.
eh.example: You're coming to the party, eh?

el.example: They rode the el to downtown Chicago.

em.example: 'Mango, did you really need to make a Genshin reference?' 'My Hutao. Needs. More EM.'

en.example: An en is equivalent to half of the body height of the typeface.

er.example: Er, I'm not sure if I want to go.

es.example: Einsteinium (Es) is a radioactive metal of the actinide series

et.example: You know, uhh, that one movie? Haven't watched it?.

fa.example: The melody rose and fell on the note fa.

fe.example: The chemical symbol for iron is Fe.

gi.example: She wore her gi to her martial arts class.

go.definition: move from one place to another.

he.example: He is going to the store.

hm.definition: used to express consideration or deliberation.
hm.example: Hm, I'm not sure if I agree with that.

ho.definition: a shout of surprise or excitement.

id.definition: the part of the mind in which innate instinctive impulses and primary processes are manifest.
id.example: The id operates on the pleasure principle.

if.example: If it rains, we'll stay indoors.

in.example: She left her keys in the car.

it.definition: used to refer to a thing previously mentioned or easily identified.

ka.example: In Shintoism, believers offer prayers to their ka.

ki.example: She felt her life force, or ki, surge within her.

la.definition: used to express surprise or pity.
la.example: La, la, la, I can't hear you!

li.example: The distance from New York to Washington is 225 li.

lo.example: Lo and behold, the treasure was right there!

ma.example: Ma, can I have some cookies?

me.definition: used to refer to the speaker as the object of a verb or preposition.
me.example: He gave me a book for my birthday.

mi.example: She sang the note mi perfectly.

mm.example: The width of the wire is 2 mm.

mo.example: Give me a moment to think about it.

mu.definition: the twelfth letter of the Greek alphabet.
mu.example: The concept of mu is important in Zen Buddhism.

my.example: My house is just down the street.

na.definition: used to express denial or refusal.

no.example: No, I don't want any dessert.

nu.definition: a member of a people inhabiting parts of Sudan and Ethiopia.
nu.example: The Nuer people live primarily in Sudan and Ethiopia.

od.definition: a supposed force or natural power.
od.example: The od of the forest seemed to fill the air.

oe.definition: a whirlwind off the Faeroe Islands.
oe.example: The sailors encountered an oe off the coast of Greenland.

of.definition: indicating an association between two entities.
of.example: The queen is the ruler of the Kingdom of England.

oh.definition: used to express a range of emotions.
oh.example: Oh, I see what you mean now.

om.example: She chanted 'om' during her yoga practice.

on.definition: physically in contact with and supported by a surface.
on.example: The book is on the table.

op.example: He underwent a heart operation last year.

or.definition: used to introduce a synonym or explanation of a preceding word or phrase.
or.example: You can have tea or coffee, whichever you prefer.

os.example: The femur is the longest bone in the os.

ox.definition: a domesticated bovine animal kept for milk or meat.
ox.example: The farmer plowed his field with an ox.

oy.definition: used to express annoyance or shock.

pa.example: Pa, can we go to the zoo?

pe.definition: ​sport and exercise that is taught in schools.
pe.example: We are having a PE class next period!

pi.definition: the sixteenth letter of the Greek alphabet.

po.example: He kept a po under his bed for emergencies.

qi.example: Practicing Tai Chi helps to balance one's qi.

re.definition: the second note of the diatonic scale of C major.
re.example: The song began with the note re.

si.example: Si, quiero una cerveza, por favor.

so.example: She was so tired that she fell asleep immediately.

ta.example: Ta, that's very kind of you.

te.example: The melody rose on the note te.

ti.definition: the seventh note of the diatonic scale of C major.
ti.example: Do, re, mi, fa, so, la, ti, do.

to.definition: expressing motion in the direction of.
to.example: He went to the store to buy some milk.

uh.example: Uh, I'm not sure how to answer that.

um.example: Um, let me think about it for a moment.

up.example: The elevator goes up to the tenth floor.

us.example: Can you give us a ride to the airport?

ut.definition: the syllable once generally used for the first note of the diatonic scale in an early solmization system and later replaced by do.
ut.example: Ut was the first note in the medieval musical scale.

we.definition: used by a speaker to refer to himself or herself and one or more other people considered together.
we.example: We went to the movies last night.

wo.definition: a state of intense antagonism or hostility.
wo.example: Wo, that was a close call!

xi.definition: the fourteenth letter of the Greek alphabet.
xi.example: Xi is the symbol for the 14th letter of the Greek alphabet.

xu.example: She exchanged some dollars for Vietnamese xu.

yo.definition: used to attract attention or to express excitement.
yo.example: Yo, check out this awesome trick!

za.example: Let's order a za for dinner tonight.
